definition: to start shooting or firing/to win an initial success/to succeed (of a plan)
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
echo/sound/noise/to make a sound/to sound/to ring/loud/classifier for noises
to win instant success (idiom)/to start off successfully

sentences.english: The show was an overnight success on Broadway .
sentences.chinese: 在百老汇的演出一炮打响。

sentences.english: At present, Puzzle Patterns are the ultimate anti-corporate battle.
sentences.chinese: 目前，迷宫模式打响了最终反企业的战斗。

sentences.english: Sun's debut album was a runaway hit.
sentences.chinese: 孙燕姿的首张专辑一炮打响。

sentences.english: You have all the infermation you require to do a bang-up job in Washington.
sentences.chinese: 你握有你需要的可在华盛顿一炮打响的全部材料。

sentences.english: The battle prohibiting toxin of an interlink at this point start shooting.
sentences.chinese: 一场连环的禁毒战役就此打响。
这是一首一炮打响的歌曲。

sentences.english: The last battle of the war was in 1781.
sentences.chinese: 战争的最后一次战役是在1781年打响的。

sentences.english: In 1911, the Wuchang Uprising fired here.
sentences.chinese: 武昌起义打响第一枪在这里。

sentences.english: That battle started in the Solomons and New Guinea last summer.
sentences.chinese: 那个战役去年夏天在所罗门群岛和新几内亚岛打响。

sentences.english: As the operation unraveled, the U. S. team called for help.
sentences.chinese: 战斗打响后，美军的这支特种部队要求增援。

sentences.english: I bought lollipops and a toot-toot bugle .
sentences.chinese: 我给她买了棒棒糖，一吹就呜的打响的小喇叭。

sentences.english: Then our reputation started to spread.
sentences.chinese: 然后我们的名声开始打响了。

sentences.english: The Liberation War broke out in autumn , 1946.
sentences.chinese: 一九四六年秋，解放战争已打响。

sentences.english: Over the years, Melita has built up a reputation and earned consumer confidence.
sentences.chinese: Melita打响了牌子，赢得了顾客的信任。

sentences.english: But the war has just started.
sentences.chinese: 不过这场战争刚刚打响。

sentences.english: A new battle against drugs on the borders has started.
sentences.chinese: 边境线上，毒品封禁的新一轮战役再次打响。

to start a war/to make war/to battle against
